definition: stubborn/inflexible/one-track minded
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)
obstinate/opinionated

stubborn/obstinate/having a one-track mind
(coll.) dim-witted/foolish/absent-minded
to stubbornly insist on one's own ideas (idiom)

stupid/senseless/dim-witted
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
